results.title: Alexeieff's commercials
results.brief_description: A collection of advertising films made by French lithographer and animator, Alexander Alexeieff, some using his own ‘pinboard’ device, and others more conventional methods of animation. The reel includes: Fumees - which took a year to make on the pinboard and lasts barely a minute, with the smoke made from hundreds of fine oscillating lines superimposed densely on each frame, and Le seve de la terre - with delicately animated glass beads to represent drops of oil.

results.title: Alexandria, why? = Iskindiria, leh? [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Youssef Chahine and Misr International Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Alexandria Trilogy”.
Set against the panoramic backdrop of war-torn Egypt, director Youssef Chahine tells a highly personal tale of love and determination. Yehia is an eighteen-year-old boy living with extended family in Alexandria. His parents, in particular his father, have made great personal sacrifices in order to send their son to expensive schools, in order that he may become an engineer. But Yehia fosters desires and ambitions to be an actor in Hollywood. Despite Yehia’s evident commitment, his father dismisses his son’s art as a serious prospect. However as Hitler’s troops advance toward Egypt, the life that Yehia and his family are accustomed to starts to crumble. Thousands flee, becoming refugees, and as prices inflate ordinary people struggle to cope with wartime rationing. Meanwhile - a group of men, disgruntled by English occupation dispatch various plots, in the hope of assassinating Churchill; a beautiful Jewess falls in love with one would-be-assassin, but her wealthy father wishes them to flee the Nazi threat; a young gay English soldier, terrified of his imminent dispatch to the Front, has an affair with a charming aristocrat. Chahine cleverly intersperses newsreel footage with the lives of his protagonists as they struggle to determine their prospects, whilst also interrogating notions of patriotism and duty versus desire and personal ambition. This autobiographical film was followed by two sequels, “Alexandria again and forever” and “An Egyptian story”. In Arabic and English with English subtitles.

results.title: Alexandria again and forever [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Youssef Chahine, Paris Classics, Misr International Films and La Sept Cinema
results.brief_description:
Episode number 3 of Series “Alexandria Trilogy”.
In this third and final instalment of Youssef Chahine’s “Alexandria” trilogy (preceded by Alexandria, why? and An Egyptian story) Chahine’s protagonist and alter-ego, Yehia, is now an aging filmmaker who laments the state of the Egyptian film industry and joins his colleagues on strike to protest their circumstances. Simultaneously Yehia (played by the director himself) finds himself attracted to two actors - the handsome young Amr, who Yehia works with on laboured productions, and Nadia, with whom he hopes to collaborate. Following on from the themes explored in “An Egyptian story”, Yahia heartlessly forfeits his personal relationships in favour of his work. Yahine’s struggle to reconcile his art with his ambitions and personal failings is set against Egypt’s divisive drive, in the 1980s, toward democratic reform. The film takes on a surreal flavour with several musical interludes (one delightfully recalling “Singin’ in the rain” as Yehia and Amr celebrate winning the Silver Bear award at Berlin). Chahine applies his signature energy to the film - an appealing mix of whimsy, satire and barbed attacks on the political and social situation in his beloved homeland.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Youssef Chahine, Paris Classics, Misr International Films and La Sept Cinema

results.title: Alexandra's project
results.creator_credit: Rolf De Heer, Domenico Procacci, Julie Ryan, South Australian Film Corporation, Palace Films and Fandango Australia
results.brief_description: What strange and sometimes nasty things go on behind closed doors in suburbia is what this feature, written and directed by Rolf de Heer, is all about. An emotionally spent housewife Alexandra (Helen Buday) organises a birthday surprise for her husband and father of her two children. After enduring years of financial and emotional shutdown at the hands of her husband (Gary Sweet), Alexandra seeks revenge and sets about to undo her husband to the level at which she feels she has been wronged. Set for the most part within the four walls of the family home “Alexandra’s Project” is a tense, sexual and unsettling drama. Nominated for five Australian Film Institute Awards and three IF Awards. Contains sex scenes.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Rolf De Heer, Domenico Procacci, Julie Ryan, South Australian Film Corporation, Palace Films and Fandango Australia

results.title: Alexander Turnbull's library
results.creator_credit: Paul Maunder, Ronald Bowie and New Zealand National Film Unit
results.brief_description: The film takes the viewer through an ordinary day of the famous Alexander Turnbull Library showing glimpses of the treasures - rare books, New Zealand and Pacific collection, manuscripts and paintings. The viewer learns that the historic building is no longer safe, and is about to be destroyed for the construction of a motorway.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Maunder, Ronald Bowie and New Zealand National Film Unit

description_for_label: The film takes the viewer through an ordinary day of the famous Alexander Turnbull Library showing glimpses of the treasures - rare books, New Zealand and Pacific collection, manuscripts and paintings. The viewer learns that the historic building is no longer safe, and is about to be destroyed for the construction of a motorway.

results.title: Alexander the Great and the Hellenistic Age
results.brief_description: Alexander’s campaigns and the spread of Greek culture are the focuses of this film. The flowering of commerce, art and science that was the Hellenistic Age is reflected in the views of Rhodes and Delas, Hellenistic sculpture, the Temple of Zeus and the archaeological treasures of Sidon Sarcophagus, the Issis mosaic and the ruins of Persepolis.

results.title: Alexander the Great and the Battle of Issus
results.creator_credit: Phil Grabsky and Seventh Art Productions
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Great commanders”.
Alexander the Great had conquered all of the then known world by the time of his death at 32. At the Battle of Issus, he led a charge across a river to crush a massive Persian force. Alexander’s military genius allowed him to employ daring strategems and from his victory at Issus, he went on to become one of the greatest commanders of all time.
